name: Andrew Hackett
about: Since graduating from the University of Nebraska in 2017 I have worked as an on-site project engineer for Howard S. Wright Construction and as a preconstruction lead or estimator for MCL Construction. In my time with Howard S Wright I went from being able to simply help on a project to having a deeper understanding of not only how to build a project but what it takes to run a project. I focused mainly on keeping the projects moving by working with subcontractors and the architect/owner to solve the many technical problems that arise on a construction site. At MCL I worked solely in pre-construction. I learned how to pursue a project and take it from a conceptual phase to a project that MCLs team is ready to start.

name: Tyler Pollock
about: I have a love and passion for Safety. I care about each and every employee that comes to work, and it is my responsibility to work with them, to make sure they get home at the end of the day. Because, that is what safety is all about, Coming Home at the End of the Day. I believe in the philosophy of 'Safe Production'. I don't want to hinder production, by implementing unneeded policies. I also won't sacrifice anyone's safety for the benefit of production. It is always about finding that balance between Safety and Production. I work with employees, supervisors and managers to make sure we find that balance. It is my goal to make sure everyone knows that I am here to Lead, Guide, and Coach Safety.

name: Angie Danaher
about: Experienced Administrative, Project Manager and Executive Assistant with dedicated work ethic and proven organization, multi-tasking, management, communication, and interpersonal skills to perform at high levels of a company or business.  Strong analytical, problem-solving, project performance, and leadership skills to take on a variety of tasks and demonstrated ability to design and improve processes to stimulate company growth.

experience.description: As Executive Assistant and Operations Manager for this well established residential home building company, along with scheduling appointments and maintaining the calendar for the Sherwood/Lane President and Owner, most of my job involves running the daily activities on the administrative side of the office by corresponding with necessary contractors and business associates, working as a liason for superintendents, subcontractors, and real estate agents and managing quotes and bids for customer selection changes and upgrades. We work with customers financial budgets to balance the desires for their homes within their financial means. I schedule subcontractors working on home projects through the finishing stages of the home and manage the closing of custom homes and schedule agent and staff meetings, organize and track agendas and minutes. I also organize and plan trainings and tours for real estate agents to educate and promote the company, organize involvement in local Home Shows and singlehandedly plan our annual Realtor Appreciation Party.

name: Tyler Hiatt
description: Student at University of Nebraska at Omaha
about: I am currently a senior at the University of Nebraska at Omaha studying construction management with minors in both business administration, and real estate land use and economics. I have worked at MCL Construction for over 4 years. I started as a part time laborer/carpenter, and then transitioned into a project engineer intern the summer after my freshman year. My second summer I changed to a field engineer intern and decided I liked that better, so I did the same FE internship my third summer. I have been able to work full time during the summer and part time during the school year, which has really been helpful being able to relate stuff from the jobsite and the classroom.

experience.description: I work closely with the superintendents on my project to coordinate with subs to help them and our field crew to more effectively and efficiently get our project built.

name: Jason Jansen

name: Jesse Parker
about: My professional experience tends to be on the construction side. Specifically concrete and carpentry. I am the diversity representative on the executive board in Douglas county. As well as the vice chair of the native caucus for the Nebraska Democratic Party. With that being I have quite the story leading up to this point in my life. I will share just a short summary, but I hope to meet some of you and share the full story. I was diagnosed with Crohn's disease when I was 18. Believe it or not though I was 16 when this all began.  This was all caused by mixing Clindamycin and Acutane. Both are powerful drugs in their own aspects. I have pushed through the tough times in life thus leading me to what the future holds for future generations. The native caucus in Douglas county will be created soon enough and I will be the chair of this chapter of the state caucus. The focus right off the bat is dealing with the youth. The seem to be very left out of every conversation about Native Americans. There are many horrific statistics I list about the youth, but I will make this one known to the public. Native American youth have the highest suicide rate of any population group in the United States. As a result I will be collaborating with a existing program here in Omaha, Ne to create a Montessori approach educational program that allows a kid to find his or her way to learning and retaining new information. Also would like to throw in there will also be a tradesmen program that will have hands on training as well as classroom work.

experience.description: Working to create local chapters to strengthen the state caucus.
